amendment.description: Amendment establishes reporting requirements for nuclear exports that are comparable to those in existing law for conventional arms; requires an agency to submit to Congress a report describing each such export and the basis for approval; and provides for Congress to have 30 days to review the proposed license and use expedited procedures to enact a resolution of disapproval if necessary.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to establish reporting requirements for nuclear exports, comparable to those currently in existence for conventional arms exports.

action.text: On agreeing to the Gilman amendment (A012) Agreed to by recorded vote: 405 - 9 (Roll No. 181).
